summary: This is an email chain from April 2020 discussing the status of an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators from July 2019. It details efforts to locate, serve subpoenas to, and interview 10 co-conspirators and approximately 25 victims across several states, primarily Florida.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Author of the April 2020 email forwarding the July 2019 update; likely from the FBI New York office.

connections.description: SSA is providing M with an investigative update regarding co-conspirators and victims, indicating a professional law enforcement reporting relationship.

events.title: Status Update on Co-conspirator Investigation
events.description: An update was provided on efforts to locate, serve grand jury subpoenas to, and interview 10 co-conspirators and approximately 25 victims related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Deployment of Investigation Team to Florida
events.description: A team of 8 Special Agents/Task Force Officers and 2 Assistant U.S. Attorneys was scheduled to fly to various locations in Florida to interview approximately 25 victims.

events.title: Activation of FBI Tip Line
events.description: The 1-800-CALL-FBI tip line was operational and had received approximately 45 calls, which were being vetted.

keyFacts: As of July 9, 2019, investigators were actively pursuing 10 co-conspirators in the Epstein case, with 6 successfully located and served grand jury subpoenas in Florida, Boston, NYC, and CT.
Four co-conspirators remained outstanding, including one identified as a wealthy businessman in Ohio, for whom a lead was being sent to CV (likely a field office).
A significant investigative team (8 SAs/TFOs and 2 AUSAs) was deploying to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims.
The FBI's national tip line had received about 45 calls related to the case, which were in the vetting process.
